medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressively increasing rash on the body over the course of a year.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The rash began progressively increasing over the course of a year, without any occurrence on the face or other sun-exposed areas. The patient also experienced telangiectasis and a positive Darier's sign, but did not report any other symptoms such as dyspnea, arthralgia, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a 50-year-old woman residing in Thailand who has never traveled abroad.
